converse.line: Sigh...
What's wrong, my pupil?
Oh, hi, Ms. S It's nothing...

choice.line: Is it something you can't share with your art teacher?
It's something stupid. I'll forget about it in a few days.
If you say so.
Okay. Just making sure.
Aren't teachers supposed to be more pushy on these things? Or at least take a hint?
I guess I fail as a teacher then.
Did you fail a test or something?
Whoa, you psychic or something? How'd you know?
It was meant to be a joke. I thought you didn't care much for school.

Well, you know my mother's been bugging me about my grades. The only class I'm passing is art, and that's because you're the only teacher I can stand. The rest despise my slow learning. Anyway, my mother has said if I don't improve, she'll ship me out of Naibu to some other school. I don't want to go there; I like it here in Mourilyan.
So you decided to study hard in every class?
Yeah, and it worked out for all of my classes except Ms. Q's class. She really hates my guts. She gave me a 67%, but I really got a high B. I can't believe her! I studied so much history too.
You have any proof of that? I know Eira to be difficult some times, but I can't believe she'd do that.

She told me to my face. Said she didn't bother grading mine cause she knew I'm a D student. I tried to explain that to my mother, but she thinks I'm lying. Now I'm going to have to move in two months.
No! I won't allow one of my better pupils to move! I'll see if I can work my social magic on her to get her to change her mind. I'm sure I can do it.
It'd mean everything to me. Thanks, Ms. S.

converse.line: Did you talk to Ms. Q for me?
Not yet. When I get a chance, I will.
You're the best, Ms. S.
Did you talk to Ms. Q for me?
I couldn't convince her. She's too biased toward your past grades.
Well, thanks for the effort, Ms. S. If you can't do it, nobody can.
Sigh...I guess I'm moving, then.
I'm sorry. I know you're not lying and if I could, I would change your grade since I know you put in the effort.
You sure you can't do anymore?
I've tried everything I can. Eira keeps her computer with her at all times, so I can't sneak in and change the grade that way.
If only I knew how to hack into the school system, I could change your grade so that you don't have to move.
Hah! I know you're an art genius, but you don't know squat when it comes to computers.
(Do I know anyone who is good with computers? Oh, wait...)
Have you checked PowerSchoolâ„¢ lately?
Nah, there's no reason to.
I think you might want to check it again.
...No way! There's a second test grade where I got an A! Did you really do this for me, Ms. S?
Yes, with a little help from a hacker genius, corporation CEO, and an overeager student. I just couldn't stand around as one of my best and brightest students left me.
I am ecstatic! But, won't you get in trouble for this?
The hacker put the test grade in for everybody, making sure it wouldn't affect anyone's average but yours and I'm pretty sure he's untraceable. There won't be any problems. Take that, Eira!
I can't thank you enough! I'm going to paint you the best picture I've done yet, and gift it to you. You really are the best. Thank you!

choice.line: How's that painting coming?
It's taking me a while, but I won't give up on it. Just like you didn't give up on letting me leave.
I can't wait to see it!
How are things going now?

Life is good, Ms. S. I've told my friends that I'll be staying and we're having a party to celebrate. I get to stay in the town I love so much. And best of all, I get to see Ms. Q.'s irritated face every day as I improve in her class. It couldn't be better.
I'm happy for you, Edwin.
